question_content.barrons:question: The passage mentions John Wesley primarily as

barrons:choices.barrons:choice: a proponent of tar-water as a cure for scurvy
a pioneer in the field of experimental philosophy
a naval surgeon who consulted with Lind

question_content.barrons:explanation:
an author who recommended specific anti-scorbutics.

The passage cites Wesley as the author of Primitive Physic, a manual of remedies, in which 11 anti-scorbutics were listed.

A proponent of tar-water as a cure for scurvy is incorrect. It was Bishop Berkeley, not John Wesley, who proposed tar-water as a cure for scurvy.

A pioneer in the field of experimental philosphy is incorrect. Nothing in the passage indicates that Wesley was a pioneer in the field of experimental philosophy.

The inheritor of Lind’s experimental method is incorrect. Nothing in the passage indicates that Wesley inherited Lind’s experimental method.

A naval surgeon who consulted with Lind is incorrect. Nothing in the passage indicates that Wesley ever consulted with Lind.
